about.intro: Three brothers united by passion for the land and respect for traditions. We decided to revive our beloved grandfather's oil company, carrying forward a legacy of authentic flavors and family values.

history.title: Since 1950, A Family Tradition
history.paragraph1: It all began in 1950, when our grandfather Francesco Galia planted the first olive trees in the Sicilian hills. With dedication and love for the land, he built a company that became synonymous with quality and authenticity.
history.paragraph2: After years when the company remained inactive, we three brothers decided to bring this family heritage back to life. Each with our own skills and specializations, but all united by the same passion for extra virgin olive oil.
history.paragraph3: Today, Galia represents the perfect meeting between tradition and innovation, keeping intact the values and methods passed down by our grandfather, but with an eye to the future.

faq.description: Find answers to the most common questions about our extra virgin oils, production and services offered by the Galia family.

questions.question: How is your extra virgin oil produced?
questions.answer: Our oil is produced following traditional methods passed down from our grandfather. Olives are strictly hand-picked at the right degree of ripeness, then cold-milled within 24 hours of harvest. We use only mechanical processes without any chemical treatment, guaranteeing a 100% natural product.

questions.question: What is the difference between your oils?
questions.answer: We offer three types: Classic Oil with intense fruity and fresh grass notes, certified Organic Oil with delicate flavor and balanced spicy aftertaste, and Premium Oil from century-old olives with complex organoleptic profile. Each oil has unique characteristics suitable for different palates and uses.

questions.question: How to best store extra virgin oil?
questions.answer: To keep the organoleptic properties intact, store the oil in a cool and dry place, away from light and heat sources. The ideal temperature is between 14-18°C. Always close the cap tightly after use and consume within 18 months of opening. Our dark bottles already protect the oil from light.

questions.question: Do you ship throughout Italy?
questions.answer: Yes, we ship throughout Italy with express courier. For orders over €50, shipping is free. We use special packaging to protect bottles during transport. Delivery times are generally 2-3 working days. For international orders, contact us for specific information.

questions.question: Is the oil really produced in Sicily?
questions.answer: Absolutely yes. Our olive groves are located in the Sicilian hills where our grandfather planted the first trees in 1950. Every phase of production takes place on site: from cultivation to harvesting, from milling to bottling. We are proud of our 100% Sicilian origin.

questions.question: What certifications does your oil have?
questions.answer: Our oils are DOP (Protected Designation of Origin) certified and comply with all Italian and European quality standards. Organic oil has BIO certification issued by an accredited body. We carry out regular chemical and organoleptic analyses to guarantee acidity below 0.3% and excellent quality parameters.

questions.question: Is it possible to visit the company?
questions.answer: Certainly! We organize guided tours by reservation where you can personally meet us three brothers, visit the olive groves, witness the production process and taste our oils. The visits also include stories about the family history and Sicilian olive oil tradition. Contact us to schedule your visit.

questions.question: How can I be sure of the quality of your oil?
questions.answer: Quality is guaranteed by three generations of experience, certified chemical analyses, manual olive harvesting, cold pressing within 24 hours and rigorous controls at every stage. Each bottle bears the batch number for complete traceability. We also offer a satisfaction or money-back guarantee.

hero.description: Three brothers united by passion for Sicilian land and respect for traditions. Our story begins in 1950 with our grandfather Francesco and continues today with the same dedication and love for superior quality extra virgin oil.

events.title: The Beginning
events.description: Francesco Galia plants the first 100 olive trees in the hills of Castelvetrano, starting what would become a family tradition.
events.details: At only 25 years old and with a loan from the local bank, Francesco buys 5 hectares of hilly land. The choice of the Nocellara del Belice variety proves to be a winner.

events.title: The Expansion
events.description: The company grows: Francesco buys new land and builds the first oil mill with stone millstones.
events.details: Thanks to the first successes, the company expands to 15 hectares. The oil mill is built following traditional Sicilian designs, with Etna lava stone millstones.

events.title: The Next Generation
events.description: Francesco's children, Salvatore and Maria, enter the company bringing new ideas and technologies.
events.details: Salvatore introduces the first sustainable agriculture techniques, while Maria takes care of local marketing. The company reaches 25 hectares.

events.title: The Difficult Period
events.description: After Francesco's death, the company goes through a difficult period and is temporarily closed.
events.details: Economic and family difficulties lead to the decision to suspend activity. The olive groves are entrusted to local farmers for maintenance.

events.title: The Rebirth
events.description: Francesco's three grandsons decide to bring their grandfather's company back to life, combining tradition and innovation.
events.details: Marco, Giuseppe and Antonio invest their savings to renovate the oil mill and modernize the facilities, maintaining traditional production methods.

events.title: The Present
events.description: Today the Galia company is recognized for the quality of its extra virgin oil and environmental sustainability.
events.details: With 30 organically cultivated hectares and 3000 olive trees, the company produces 15,000 liters of extra virgin oil per year, exporting throughout Europe.

brothers.title: The Three Brothers
brothers.subtitle: Each with their own skills and specializations, but all united by the same passion for excellence and love for our land.

profiles.name: Marco Galia
profiles.description: The eldest of the brothers, Marco inherited the passion for the land from his grandfather Francesco. After graduating in Agriculture, he spent years perfecting organic cultivation and cold pressing techniques.
profiles.speciality: Agronomist specialized in organic olive growing
profiles.quote: Each harvested olive carries the flavor of our land
profiles.details: Marco gets up every morning at dawn to personally check the olive groves. His experience allows him to recognize the perfect moment for harvesting, when the olives have reached the right degree of ripeness.

profiles.name: Giuseppe Galia
profiles.description: Giuseppe brought a breath of modernity to the family business. His commercial vision has allowed Galia oil to reach national and international markets, always maintaining product authenticity.
profiles.speciality: Degree in Marketing and Communication - Master in Export Management
profiles.quote: We bring Sicilian tradition to the world, one bottle at a time
profiles.details: Giuseppe has developed a network of distributors throughout Europe and created partnerships with starred restaurants that appreciate the quality of Galia oil.

profiles.name: Antonio Galia
profiles.description: The youngest and most methodical of the brothers, Antonio has modernized all business processes. His administrative and organizational precision ensures that every aspect of the business works perfectly.
profiles.speciality: Chartered Accountant - Specialization in Management Control
profiles.quote: Organization is the heart of every great tradition
profiles.details: Antonio has implemented a complete product traceability system, from plant to bottle, guaranteeing maximum transparency to customers.
